summary: This document is a query from a staff member at MCC New York regarding perceived preferential treatment for an inmate, likely Jeffrey Epstein, concerning meal delivery to attorney conferences and special bathroom escort procedures. It suggests Epstein was receiving different treatment than other inmates.

persons.name: Serena Williams
persons.context: Her quote is used as a signature line in the correspondence, but she has no direct involvement in the Epstein case or this specific incident.

locations.context: The Metropolitan Correctional Center where the inmate (likely Jeffrey Epstein) was housed and where the alleged preferential treatment was occurring.

keyFacts: An inmate (strongly implied to be Jeffrey Epstein) at MCC New York was allegedly receiving meals delivered directly to the attorney conference room for every feeding, unlike standard procedure.
Management allegedly instructed that this inmate be escorted to the restroom every hour without restraints, despite being a Special Housing Unit (SHU) inmate.
Standard procedure for other inmates attending court or attorney conferences during meal times is to receive a pre-packed bagged lunch.
The author of the correspondence questions if this constitutes clear preferential treatment and asks if the process has changed for all inmates or just this specific one.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY Epstein case files, indicating it relates to the investigation or circumstances surrounding his incarceration.
